reviewText: A great chance to relive some happy moments from the seventies. These are not complete episodes. Not sure why, but some guest stars are only in the introduction. As far as compliations go, however, all their greatest hits are included although they could have cut a few "Tie a Yellow Ribbon" reprises and included other skits or music. Great fun though.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Lovers of small-screen variety shows have something to sing about ... call it, if you will, the dawn of some really big shows. Back in the mid-70s, Daryl Dragon and Toni Tennille were big; Tony Orlando, Telma Hopkins and Joyce Vincent were bigger. Now, both have been reunited in two separate three-disc collections, each featuring the best cuts and memorable moments from their TV excursions. The Captain and Tennille prove that love (and laughter) have always kept us together as we relive appearances by Dionne Warwick, John Travolta and the original heavenly Charlie's Angels (Farrah, Jaclyn and Kate). Tony and his gals welcome everyone from Kate Smith to Sly & the Family Stone, Alice Cooper to Milton Berle. Some may call it kitsch, others cap. We call them gifts worthy of being gaily tied with yellow ribbons.
summary: MUSICAL MOMENTS ARE MADE FROM THESE RETRO SHOWS
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD set is truly a reminder of the quality of past television programs.  The music was something you could sing along to and the comedy was truly worthy of the name.  If you remember when this show was popular you will thoroughly enjoy reliving the memories.  If you are too young to remember the show this is a chance to see what you missed.  The set contains three DVD's with four shows on each one.  After watching the first show I had to keep going until I had seen all four programs on the first DVD.  The price for this set is not steep considering the quality you are getting.  It would certainly be very easy to watch the same program several times.  If there are people in nursing homes who would remember the Tony Orlando and Dawn show it would be an uplifting experience for them to view these shows again.

reviewText: Indeed this is real entertainment of a higher dimension of qualities, compared to the garbage television studios shove to the small home screen on prime time every week night as of these past few years. The so called "professional reviewers" can call the skits and sketches "corny" all they desire, but, TONY ORLANDO & DAWN caught the public's massive imagination for a few seasons during the[now]highly celebrated 1970's decade, whose music has eclipsed the 80's revival, which never seemed to have gotten off the ground at the dawn of the 2000's. Ditto for shows such as SONNY & CHER COMEDY HOUR, DONNY & MARIE, CAPTAIN & TENILLE SHOW, FLIP WILSON SHOW, and several others from the second decade of golden era of variety shows. I just bought TOAD's[Tony Orlando And Dawn]YELLOW RIBBON COLLECTION Cd Box set, featuring completely remastered versions of all six of their multimillion selling studio albums adorned with many bonus tracks alongside the hit singles from this popular singing group - a great companion to this "Ultimate 3-DVD Collection" from their exciting TV show. Great music and fun times for all to enjoy all over again. Just like another fan noted: back in the 70's you could hear Tony & Dawn - Led Zep - Donna Fargo on the same Top 40 Pop-Rock radio stations 24/7, which is a rarity now. Who said you can never go back? Oh, YES you can...it's all right here, right now!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Today's prime-time TV may have your share of sit-coms, game shows, and SOME reality shows that are ok, but other shows like TODAY's crime dramas and news programs aren't well wouth watching.  Go back in time when it was all right watching those wholesome family variety shows that network TV lacks today.  Of course times were tough during the mid 70's, but television prime-time back then had those happy wholesome variety shows that helped provide a breath of fresh air.  "Tony Orlando and Dawn" was a great example.  Tony Orlando reached out to his live audience and home viewers to forget about the tough times America was going through and just think positive thoughts.I really like this DVD!  I just can't get enough of it!
summary: The love of the 1970's TV variety shows from a 1970's pop culture fan.

reviewText: I had the pleasure of seeing Tony Orlando and Dawn at their concert in LA to celebrate the release of this DVD collection - and after hearing the music I had not heard for years I knew I had to have the set.  It is a terrific retrospective on a really fun and happy time in music - lot of hits you will have forgotten about and be happy you rediscovered - and a kitchy, innocent, fun, and often funny period in television.  A great 3 DVD collection - and perfect for families and/or to relive a bygone era.  As usual - R2 Entertainment did a great job with the set - good design - lots of extras - very collectable looking.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Take a trip down memory lane to the 1970s with a group that dominated television and the air-waves for a few years.On disc one are the best bits of their debut in 1974 on CBS right through to the show "Rainbow Hour" in 1977. They are joined by The Great Man - Jackie Gleason, Danny Thomas, Dom De Luise and others.Disc two has sketches by comedians Moreen and Lou Effy while Tony lives his dream of being Elvis and a kung fu master amoung others. Joining them are many Hollywood legends like Milton Berle, Phillis Diller, Neil Sedaka, Adrienne Barbeau and more.Relive their great hits like: 'Tie a Yellow Ribbon Around the Ole Oak Tree', 'Knock Three Times', 'Sweet Gypsy Rose', I Write the Songs', 'Breaking Up is Hard to do', and so many to mention here.And lastly, disc three has extras of their hits, the original gig in 1976 on "The Tonight Show", the 1981 "Friday" cult favourite with Father Guido Starducci, a jukebox and bonus tracks, and a sketch from "Carol Burnett Show" in 1975. Also joining them are Jerry Lewis, Alice Cooper, Freddie Prinze, Englebert Humperdinck and others.I recommend this set to those who remember Tony Orlando and Dawn, and especially to those who haven't seen them before. Enjoy nine hours of pure unadultured entertainment from an era when music was music and bands got high on the rhythm, not only LSD. I gave this collection five stars as there will never songs like these again.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Others have written wonderful reviews of this extraordinary DVD collection and I share their enthusiasm wholeheartedly.  There is not one DVD set in my collection that I've enjoyed more than this one.  Tony, Joyce, and Telma are three of the most talented artists to ever grace the stage and their show is a joy to watch.  A show such as theirs is a true television treasure and deserves to be preserved on DVD in its entirety.A long time ago television was really like this!  It made you laugh and sing along.  Tony and Dawn introduced us to many guest stars - some no longer with us.  We laughed up a storm with Jackie Gleason, Ted Knight, Phyllis Diller, Dom DeLuise, Ruth Buzzi, Danny Thomas, Milton Berle, and the incredible Freddie Prinze.  Tony and Dawn sang their own hits and every other style of music be it soul, country, gospel, or pop.  Tony, Joyce, and Telma knew how to have fun with their guests and their audience and the camaraderie shines here! The audience finales alone (all unscripted) feature more humor and fun than any modern day sitcom.  This show made you feel good and, thanks to this DVD collection, it still has the power to do just that.I am fortunate to have ten installments of this series on VHS that were recorded several years ago from The Nostalgia Channel. Most (but not all) of those ten are beautifully restored here; and we also have the additional "Juke Box" feature to enjoy.  The "Extras" are great too; but how great it would be to see the two Christmas episodes of "Tony Orlando and Dawn" on DVD!  And then there's an appearance or two (or more?) of Tony with Freddie Prinze on "Dinah", not to mention their appearance together on "Chico and the Man".  This list could go on, I'm sure, but when it comes down to great entertainment one volume simply isn't enough!To R2 Entertainment - this is an outstanding presentation!  To DVD collectors everywhere - buy it, have a great time, and introduce your children to Tony, Joyce, and Telma.  Children need to see a show like this - full of warmth, fun, humor, and music.  It may even influence them musically.  I was the ripe old age of seven when "Tony Orlando and Dawn" premiered and before the show left the airwaves I had begun my own odyssey into music performance.  This odyssey continues to this very day.  Thank you, R2 Entertainment, for reintroducing me to my first idols.Let's hope we see more of "Tony Orlando and Dawn" in a Volume Two collection because, like Tony's guest Mr. Jackie Gleason says, "Oh how sweet it is!"
summary: A true television treasure!  Bring on Volume Two!

reviewText: First, this was exactly as the seller described - and more.  I bought it as a used item in 'like new' condition and it was perfect.  We've always been big fans of Tony Orlando and Dawn but seeing the show all over again in living color (brilliant I might add) was quite a trip.  No matter how many times I hear 'Knock Three Times on the Ceiling', I never tire of it.  And yes, at the time (mid-70s) our son really did wear a carbon-copy of Tony Orlando's hair style.  A great set of DVDs.
summary: Now I Know Who My Son Modeled His Hairstyle After!
